glsa.title: PCSC-Lite: Multiple vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in PCSC-Lite, the worst of which could lead to privilege escalation.

background.p: PCSC-Lite is a middleware to access a smart card using the SCard API (PC/SC).

description.p: The SCardReleaseContext function normally releases resources associated with the given handle (including “cardsList”) and clients should cease using this handle. However, a malicious client can make the daemon invoke SCardReleaseContext and continue issuing other commands that use “cardsList”, resulting in a use-after-free. When SCardReleaseContext is invoked multiple times it additionally results in a double-free of “cardsList”.

impact.p: A local attacker could use a malicious client to connect to pcscd’s Unix socket, possibly resulting in a Denial of Service condition or privilege escalation since the daemon is running as root.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
